briefTitle: TREXIMET (Formerly Known as TREXIMA) for the Acute Treatment of Probable Migraine (ICHD-II 1.6.1)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* At least a 6 month history of probably migraine (6 migraine attacks per month)
* Males and women of childbearing potential on a adequate contraception.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Physician diagnosis of migraine; history of triptan or ergot use; history of headache prophylaxis use
* Pregnant and/or nursing mother
* History of cardiovascular disease.
* Uncontrolled hypertension.
* Basilar or Hemiplegic migraine
* History of stroke or transient ischemic attacks (TIA).
* History of epilepsy or treated with anti-epileptics within the past 5 years.
* Impaired hepatic or renal function.
* History of gastrointestinal bleeding or ulceration.
* Allergy or hypersensitivity to Aspirin or any other NSAID.
* Allergy or hypersensitivity to triptans.
* Participated in an investigational drug trial in the previous 4 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain-Free at 2 Hours Post-dose and Sustained Pain-Free From 2-24 Hours Post-dose.
outcomeMeasures.description: Pain-free was defined as a headache severity of no pain (grade 0) at 2 hours post-treatment in subjects who have not used rescue medication prior to or at the time of the assessment. Sustained pain-free response was defined as pain-free at 2 hours post-treatment through 24 hours post-treatment without rescue medicine.

outcomeMeasures.title: Freedom From Headache Pain at 0.5, 1, and 4 Hours After Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: Pain-Free is defined as post-treatment headache pain severity of none in subjects who have not used rescue medication prior to or at the time of the assessment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Sustained Headache Relief 2-24 Hours After Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: Sustained pain relief was defined as having pain relief (mild or no pain) at 2 hours w/o any moderate or severe pain during 2-24 hour period post-treatment, without rescue medication.

outcomeMeasures.title: Headache Relief at 4, 2, 1 and 0.5 Hours After Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: Pain relief was defined as reduction of headache pain from a baseline severity of moderate or severe to none or mild at the given time.

outcomeMeasures.title: Subjects Who Used Rescue Medication From 0 - 24 Hours After Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: Rescue medication defined as additional medication (i.e. sumatriptan/naproxen sodium as open-label rescue or other medication as permitted per protocol), taken by subject for the treatment of headache pain or other symptoms associated with the headache attack.

outcomeMeasures.title: Intermediate Sustained Pain Relief: Post-dose at Intervals of 2-4 Hours and 1-2 Hours After Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: Intermediate sustained pain relief was defined as achieving headache pain relief (from moderate or severe pain at baseline to mild or no pain) prior to the specified timepoint (1 or 2 hours) and maintaining it to the specified timepoint (2-4 hours). (Intermediate=Intermed.)

outcomeMeasures.title: Intermediate Sustained Pain-Free: Post-dose at Intervals of 2-4 Hours and 1-2 Hours
outcomeMeasures.description: Intermediate sustained pain free was defined as achieving headache pain-free (moderate or severe pain to no pain) prior to the specified timepoint (1 or 2 hours) and maintaining it to the specified timepoint (2-4 hours).(Intermediate=Intermed.)

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Headache Associated: Neck Pain, Sinus Pain, Photophobia, Phonophobia, Nausea at Time Intervals of 4 and 2 Hours After Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: Neck pain, sinus pain, photophobia, phonophobia and nausea are considered headache-associated symptoms.(Headache-associated=Headache-Assoc.)

outcomeMeasures.title: Medication Satisfaction: Mean Patient Perception of Migraine (PPMQ-R) Subscale Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Patient Perception of Migraine Questionnaire-Revised(PPMQ-R) evaluates subject satisfaction with treatment 24 hours post-dose using validated questions. Questions are analyzed on 4 subscale scores (efficacy, functionality, ease-of-use, and tolerability) and total score. Scores range from 0-100, with the higher scores indicating better satisfaction.
